required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hearing Aid Signal Processing Comparative Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Compare Patient Perceptions of Two Different Hearing Aid Signal Processing Philosophies

brief_summary.textblock: Participants will be fit with each of two hearing instruments in an ABA cross-over design. The study will consist of a total of three approximately 10-day home trials with the devices. Participants will be asked to provide qualitative feedback to investigators regarding the performance of and their preference for each hearing instrument.

study_design_info.masking_description: Identifying information will be removed from the hearing instruments before fitting the participants. However, participants may be able to research hearing instruments and identify devices based on physical appearance.

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of home trial 1 (10 days after study start)
primary_outcome.description: Qualitative feedback questionnaire authored by the investigators to gather feedback on particular areas of focus. Subjects will rate hearing performance and satisfaction on a Likert scale with lowest number equivalent to worst performance or least satisfied and higher number equivalent to best performance or most satisfied.

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of home trial 2 (20 days after study start)
primary_outcome.description: Qualitative feedback questionnaire authored by the investigators to gather feedback on particular areas of focus. Subjects will rate hearing performance and satisfaction on a Likert scale with lowest number equivalent to worst performance or least satisfied and higher number equivalent to best performance or most satisfied.

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of home trial 3 (30 days after study start)
primary_outcome.description: Qualitative feedback questionnaire authored by the investigators to gather feedback on particular areas of focus. Subjects will rate hearing performance and satisfaction on a Likert scale with lowest number equivalent to worst performance or least satisfied and higher number equivalent to best performance or most satisfied.

arm_group.description: Participants will be fit with hearing instruments A and B in the following order: Hearing instrument A Hearing instrument B Hearing instrument A
Participants will be fit with hearing instruments A and B in the following order: Hearing instrument B Hearing instrument A Hearing instrument B

intervention.description: Commercially available receiver-in-canal hearing instrument from manufacturer A
Commercially available receiver-in-canal hearing instrument from manufacturer B

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Moderate to severe sensorineural hearing loss
- Current hearing aid user
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of willingness to wear study devices for approximately one month
- Inability to travel to study appointments or to complete questionnaires.
